 Based on foreknowledge of Pharaoh hardening his own heart first (Exodus 8:15 and 8:32).
 
 And the judgments were specifically selected to address the Egyptians faith in their various 'gods.'
 
 For I will go through the land of Egypt on that night, and will strike down all the first-born in the land of Egypt, both man and beast; and against all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgments -- I am the Lord. (Exodus 12:12)
 
 Nile River Judgment (Exodus 7:14-25):
 The Nile River was changed to blood. This plague was against the god Hapi, spirit of the Nile in flood and "giver of life to all men."
 
 Frogs Judgment (Exodus 8:1-15):
 The land was filled with them so that they became objects of loathing. The frog-headed goddess, Hekt (52, 62), played a part in "creation." 
 
 And so on.
